Description: F# presentations and notes. Contribute to dsyme/fsharp-presentations development by creating an account on GitHub.

Title: TypeScript 4.4 and more readable code | I CAN MAKE THIS WORK
Description: An exciting feature is shipping with TypeScript 4.4. It has the name "Control Flow Analysis of Aliased Conditions" which is quite a mouthful. This post unpacks what this feature is, and demonstrates the contribution it makes to improving the readability of code.

Title: I figured out how DMARC works, and it almost broke me
Description: How to use SPF, DKIM, and DMARC to improve your domain's email security and limit spoofing - but written for humans.

Title: Publish Azure Static Web Apps with Bicep and Azure DevOps | I CAN MAKE THIS WORK
Description: This post demonstrates how to deploy Azure Static Web Apps using Bicep and Azure DevOps. It includes a workaround for the "Provider is invalid.  Cannot change the Provider. Please detach your static site first if you wish to use to another deployment provider." issue.

Title: Announcing TypeScript 4.4 RC
Description: Today we’re excited to announce our Release Candidate (RC) of TypeScript 4.4! Between now and the stable release of TypeScript 4.4, we expect no further changes apart from critical bug fixes. To get started using the RC, you can get it through NuGet,

Title: Cascadia Code Font
Description: For many years, I’ve wanted to use real mathematical notation in computer programs for code that is mathematical in nature. The document UnicodeMath discusses this in some detail in Section 6. Using UnicodeMath in Programming Languages. Over the years, some advances beyond ASCII (invented in the 1960’s!) have been made.

Title: OpenAI's Codex as a Chrome extension
Description: This is real. OpenAI's Codex is phenomenal, and it clearly already knows the DOM layout of many popular websites. All I did was wrap it in a Chrome extension...

Title: Are Microservices … for real?
Description: We decide to dig into the details of what makes a microservice and do we really understand them as Joe tells us why we really want microservices, Allen incorrectly answers the survey, and Michael breaks down in real time.

Title: Afghan Taliban co-founder ‘released’ by Pakistan
Description: Pakistan has released Afghanistan’s Taliban leader from prison, a spokesman for the Taliban said on Thursday.
